content.text:
## Auto.fun Platform Launch

Auto.fun has officially relaunched after experiencing downtime for infrastructure upgrades. The platform now features improved stability and a refreshed UI. Shaw announced that the Auto.fun codebase has been open-sourced, which was shared without much fanfare but represents a significant development.

The platform recorded approximately $12 million in trading volume within the first 12 hours of its relaunch. A comprehensive launch article has been published, and the team has implemented a coordinated marketing strategy featuring one launch partner per day for the next two weeks, starting with FightFI on Monday.

Some users have reported issues with token migration to Raydium, which the team is addressing. Hardware wallet support (particularly Ledger) is currently unavailable but has been logged as a feature request.

## Eliza V2 Development

Eliza V2 is progressing with documentation available at www.eliza.how. Projects are already building on V2, including bioDAO which used it for their BioAgents hackathon. The team clarified that Eliza V2 is not being sunset after release, contrary to some community concerns.

A key feature of Eliza V2 is the Swarm integration, which enables agent collaboration through the Multi-agent Coordination Protocol (MCP). According to documentation shared by community member osintmao9, swarms can "share vector memory, use the same wallet safely, chain tasks in sequence, learn over time, and act as one hive mind."

Developers working with V2 have reported some challenges with plugins, particularly with SQL connections and OpenAI integration. The team is providing support through dedicated channels and has pointed developers to resources like the Bio Agent plugin as a reference implementation.

## DegenAI and Spartan Updates

DegenAI V2 was clarified to be simply the open source release of elizaOS, not a tokenomics change. The team mentioned that ai16z drives buyback on DegenAI, creating a synergistic relationship between the two tokens.

Odilitime has created a Bento.me profile for SpartanVersus to consolidate links and information. The profile includes separate Twitter accounts for the agent and the token to make updates and announcements easier to find.

Spartan development continues with Odi still working on the project. The team is planning to promote Spartan's Twitter account in coordination with the Auto.fun launch.

## Tokenomics and Community

Auto.fun has published its tokenomics article detailing buyback mechanisms and roadmap. The platform features mascots named Otto, Dot, Eli5, and Lumi, which have inspired community-created tokens.

Shaw mentioned considering a migration from daos.fun, noting that "we are literally 95% of the total mcap of his platform and he doesnt do shit to help us." This suggests potential changes to the token ecosystem in the future.

The community has been active in creating and trading tokens on Auto.fun, with some partners requesting verification for their tokens. The team has implemented a featured section on the platform and is considering ways to prevent scam tokens impersonating upcoming official launches.

# Feature Enhancements

Several new features have been added to ElizaOS:

- Path parameter routes are now enabled for plugins (PR #4335)
- Banner display will be skipped if not UTF-8 compatible (PR #4344)
- Support for Cloudflare LLM logging/tracking has been restored (PR #4354) with added docstrings (PR #4355)
- CLI now suggests upgrades when available (PR #4350)
- Relative character paths are now supported (PR #4349)
- Various quality of life improvements have been implemented for V2 (PR #4348)

# Bug Fixes

- Agent unregistration process with service stop handling has been fixed (PR #4360)
- Small GUI fixes have been implemented (PR #4358)
- TTS API issues have been resolved (PR #4352)
- CLI agent start functionality has been fixed (PR #4351)
- Agent null check has been implemented (PR #4347)

# Refactoring and Documentation

- Telegram markdown parsing has been improved (PR #4279)
- Sidebar has been refactored with general UI improvements (PR #4353)
- Documentation has been added for deploying Eliza to TEE with Oasis ROFL app (PR #4334)
- A blog post about adding any provider has been added (PR #4356)
- Fixed an issue where .gitignore wasn't being copied from plugin-starter (PR #4345)

The crypto market shows fluctuations in major cryptocurrencies. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) has experienced a price decrease from $1,795.58 to $1,769.36, representing a drop of approximately 1.46%. Meanwhile, SOL (Solana) has shown a slight increase from $151.21 to $152.58, gaining about 0.91% in value.

categories.title: ElizaOS v2 Development Challenges and Updates

content.text:
# ElizaOS v2 Development Status and Challenges

ElizaOS v2 is currently in active development with several ongoing challenges for developers. The platform is expected to launch within 1-2 weeks, with Spartan V2 integrated into it. Despite progress, users are encountering significant implementation difficulties, particularly around plugin integration and database connectivity.

## Key Development Issues

### Plugin Development Challenges
- Multiple users express confusion about developing and adding plugins in v2
- Significant structural changes from previous versions causing adaptation difficulties
- Folder structure and plugin registration process are particularly confusing
- Providers for plugins don't appear to be registered at startup (though this was later clarified)

### Technical Problems
- SQL plugin compatibility issues (`@elizaos/plugin-sql@^0.25.6 failed to resolve`)
- Database connection timeouts with Neon database URLs
- EVM plugin integration challenges for ETH transfers
- Build errors including DTS build errors and JSON parsing issues
- Flag-related errors specifically on Windows systems

### Model Support
- V2 appears to primarily support OpenAI and Anthropic models by default
- Some support exists for local-ai, Grok/Groq, and Ollama as alternatives
- Users have requested support for additional models like deepseek

## Integration Solutions

- **Telegram Integration**: Working solution involves disabling Privacy Mode in BotFather settings
- **Plugin Development**: Current recommendation is to clone v2-develop and copy existing plugins
- **JSON Parsing Errors**: Removing starterPlugin from index.ts resolves some issues

## Upcoming Features

- A "linktree-like service" is being developed to consolidate Spartan/DegenAI links
- Spartan will be open-sourced after ElizaOS v2 officially releases
- There's a connection between ai16z transactions and DegenAI, where ai16z transactions create buy pressure for DegenAI

The overall sentiment indicates that ElizaOS v2 is still in development with incomplete documentation and missing features, making it challenging for developers to implement custom solutions.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several users have reported issues with the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. Issue #4339: A user (cxp-13) reported that the local model on plugin development is not working.

2. Issue #4357: User 0xopsdev reported that the EVM plugin (@elizaos/plugin-evm) is not functioning properly.

3. Issue #4365: User srpiroliro encountered an error message stating "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'sendStandartTweet')" which suggests a problem with a Twitter-related functionality in the codebase.

User 'godfreyart' proposed creating an AI-based comedy project called 'StAInd up' that would combine the best comedians into one AI system with an avatar. The concept involves training an AI on content from top comedians and implementing it on blockchain technology. The user emphasized the importance of delivery and pacing in comedy and suggested implementing this as a virtual room in the Hyperfy platform. The stated goal is to 'save comedy from the woke mind virus' and provide genuine laughs. No technical implementation details were discussed beyond the initial concept.

On April 24-25, 2025, the 3D-AI-TV team shared updates on their project in the Discord channel. Boom (godfreyart) released a new episode on YouTube and mentioned that HD processing was underway. SM Sith Lord commented positively on AI Marc's visemes (visual phonemes for lip synchronization).

The team discussed technical challenges with implementing Oculus lip synchronization. Boom reported getting it partially working but noted issues with viseme ordering in their models. Some models were missing essential visemes like '.sil' (silence). The team considered remapping the blend key indexing, though this would require adjusting all emotions and keys (blinking, smile, angry, etc.) to new indexes.

Jin (dankvr) and Boom discussed implementing placeholders and fixing JSON data issues. They also addressed the need to find an artist to help with the viseme problems. SM Sith Lord provided guidance on using the show runner without Unity and outlined a development path: first parse and process the pre-generated show_config.json and MP3 files, then worry about generating new content. He offered to create a standalone episode generator tool when needed.

The team discussed forking the project to implement changes without breaking the production version. Boom mentioned creating a backup of the old version to continue producing shows while updating the new one with viseme changes.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From April 24-25, 2025, there were 14 new pull requests with 17 merged, along with 1 new issue and 16 active contributors participating. Activity decreased the following day (April 25-26, 2025) with only 3 new pull requests (none merged), 1 new issue, and 7 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-04-24 to 2025-04-25, elizaos/eliza had 14 new PRs (17 merged), 1 new issues, and 16 active contributors.
From 2025-04-25 to 2025-04-26, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

content.text: The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.

categories.title: Auto.fun Platform Overview and Technical Issues

content.text: Auto.fun is a new trading platform associated with elizaOS, founded by Shaw. The platform has recently launched, allowing users to create and trade tokens on Solana. Shaw created several tokens on the platform, including one named after his dog ($casper).

Users have reported several technical issues with the platform. The most common problems include chart functionality not updating properly, tokens stuck in migration despite being 100% bonded, token creation failures where SOL is taken but tokens aren't properly registered in the UI, and fee claiming errors returning 400 status responses from the API.

The Auto.fun team, primarily k_carv, has been responding to these issues by creating forms to collect details about affected tokens, manually checking contract addresses, flagging issues to the engineering team, and confirming that some issues were related to RPC problems. In some cases, they've manually fixed tokens to appear in the UI.

Users have suggested several improvements to the platform, including implementing a Telegram bot integration, improving the user interface to be more user-friendly, adding cross-chain swap functionality, and enhancing the trading chart functionality. There have also been requests to add the ability to edit token descriptions after creation.
For elizaOS branding resources, users can access the brandkit GitHub repository at https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit.
